intro: Osteospermum pinnatilobatum, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its vibrant, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow and pink. The plant has a compact, bushy growth habit with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically arranged in dense clusters, with a central disc surrounded by ray florets. Osteospermum pinnatilobatum is well-suited for gardens and landscapes due to its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in full sun.
